thread.title: Middlesbrough FC face jet-lag doubts over Ghana winger Albert Adomah
thread.title_full: Middlesbrough FC face jet-lag doubts over Ghana winger Albert Adomah

title: Middlesbrough FC face jet-lag doubts over Ghana winger Albert Adomah
text:
14:25 CET Middlesbrough FC face jet-lag doubts over Ghana winger Albert Adomah - www.ghanasoccernet.com 
Adomah scored for Ghana in a 1-1 friendly draw against Canada in Washington DC on Tuesday night and set off last night on his 3657 mile trip back to Middlesbrough. 
And striker Stuani got an assist in Uruguay's 2-0 World Cup qualifying group win over Bolivia in La Paz and is now en route on his 6,353 mile trip. 
Full-back Tomas Kalas reported for duty at Rockliffe today after his own stint on international duty â€“ although his trip was far shorter. 
He played for the Czech Republic in a 3-2 win over Holland in Amsterdam on Tuesday then flew back to Prague for a debrief before arriving back last night. 
All three will be assessed ahead of Saturday's Riverside clash with Fulham but the first two are far more likely to be suffering fatigue from their trips. 
Kalas only played the last 20 minutes and his trip was a short-haul so he should be fit and available while right-back rival Emilio Nsue pulled out of the Equatorial Guinea squad for the 2-0 friendly defeat in Kosovo on Saturday and has been back in Rockliffe training this week. 
First teamer Jack Stephens was with the England Under-21s this week but did not feature in the 3-0 win over Kazakhstan in Coventry. 
For more Ghana football news visit www.ghanasoccernet.com
